text:
Hi, I have a small question about failure testing:
I have a utility function that return a Script, the function have some validation for the input params using `assertMsg`  before those params are used to create a contract. In my test script I bind this function (with some invalid input) to a variable so when the test script is run the validations break the execution flow. I'd like to know if any built-in failure assertion available for such cases?
Since it's not creating contract nor exercising any choice, the `submitMustFail` is definitely not an option. I also try looking for `assertFail` in the doc but it's also not applicable. Hope anyone here can point me to the right direction, your help is much appreciated.

elements.text:

text: is the `wartremover-extension` published somewhere? or I should build it from the splice repo and refer to that jar instead? I'm trying to build a kms driver using the docs here <https://docs.digitalasset.com/operate/3.3/tutorials/kms_driver_guide.html> and when I'm doing `sbt assembly` It complains about that
